issue.title: google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.co.jp/index.html?zx=1763826810772&no_sw_cr=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.jp%2Findex.html%3Fzx%3D1763826810772%26no_sw_cr%3D1) ### Comment > I would like to report an issue Ive noticed with AdGuard DNS filtering. However, I wasnt sure where I should submit the report, so I ended up posting it on an unrelated website. I apologize for that. > The issue is that the battery consumption of DNS filtering suddenly increased. For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/j60pgi55fbc40wok8ks4wks8owck04khh6uvs1g40o.png?nc=1)

issue.title: google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.co.jp/index.html?zx=1763826810772&no_sw_cr=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.jp%2Findex.html%3Fzx%3D1763826810772%26no_sw_cr%3D1) ### Comment > I would like to report an issue Ive noticed with AdGuard DNS filtering. However, I wasnt sure where I should submit the report, so I ended up posting it on an unrelated website. I apologize for that. > The issue is that the battery consumption of DNS filtering suddenly increased. For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/j60pgi55fbc40wok8ks4wks8owck04khh6uvs1g40o.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/gjcwacvvyn4g8wcgck0g48s00gwcssc78tc4j8htz8.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14 System version: | `iOS18.7.2` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `System default`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/ios/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Other:
AdGuard DNS

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%86%D0%BE+%D1%81+%D0%BE%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BC&udm=2&tbs=rimg%3ACZVPwXjSZl9yYf2IpRRdPx0xsgIAwAIA2AIA4AIA&cs=1&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCAQuIIBahgKEwigzsbzgZeRAxUAAAAAHQAAAAAQgAE&biw=1707&bih=799&dpr=1.5](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25D0%25BA%25D0%25BE%25D0%25BB%25D1%258C%25D1%2586%25D0%25BE%2B%25D1%2581%2B%25D0%25BE%25D0%25BF%25D0%25B0%25D0%25BB%25D0%25BE%25D0%25BC%26udm%3D2%26tbs%3Drimg%253ACZVPwXjSZl9yYf2IpRRdPx0xsgIAwAIA2AIA4AIA%26cs%3D1%26hl%3Den%26sa%3DX%26ved%3D0CCAQuIIBahgKEwigzsbzgZeRAxUAAAAAHQAAAAAQgAE%26biw%3D1707%26bih%3D799%26dpr%3D1.5) ### Comment > the top fifth of the screen becomes unusable thanks to this notification that never disappears. Or, it it does, it shows up again!!!! I tried to disable the russian filter but for some reason it turns on automatically ater I leave the settings page. ### Screenshots
